title: Game freezing; stable fps and ping
body:
Before Christmas, my parents switched ISPs from Frontier to TWC (now Spectrum). Ever since that change, my game has had odd freezing issues. E.g when in a teamfight, sometimes all particles disappear and all I see are champions teleporting around and randomly loosing health. This seems to happen at random and can be a minor issue some games, but other times it makes the game basically unplayable. I have these 'freezes' last anywhere from .5 seconds to up to 30 seconds (usually only in teamfights). Seems like its packet loss but not sure.
 
Things that I've done:
Reinstalled LoL
Changed my internet adapter (currently using a Linksys USB adapter)
Played other multiplayer games (CS:GO, DoTA2, Warframe, Overwatch, PoE, TheDivision), all of which had no issues

I'm not really tech-savvy, so I'm not really sure what else to do. I'm pretty sure the root cause is the switch in my internet provider but I would like any advice on troubleshooting and what not so I can actually play ranked again.

P.S forgot to add I live in SoCal, Temecula to be exact. Also my FPS and ping are both stable, moreso than before the ISP switch.

Thanks in advance,
911operator

replies.body: It sounds like you're having some network issues holding strong comms with the game server, and might be experiencing packet loss.  I suggest running a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for these recent matches to get an overview of your specific issue.  Let me know what you find!

I have just ran the log reader for my most recent games and here is an example from my most recent [game](https://snag.gy/UjwOB2.jpg). It says I have a ping problem but I'm pretty sure that is not the case. I have tried all the solutions listed except for the ones that require contacting my ISP. Any other things I should try, or am I out of luck?
